thread.title: Stack is back: motorists told to prepare for more travel misery
thread.title_full: Stack is back: motorists told to prepare for more travel misery | Meridian - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Stack is back: motorists told to prepare for more travel misery
text:
Operation stack is being put in place on the M20 yet again due to traffic heading to the Port of Dover, according to police.
The emergency traffic measure, which sees lorries queuing on the motorway while non freight traffic is diverted, has been used several times in the last month.
Kent Police RPU @kentpoliceroads Follow ADVANCED NOTICE: #OpStack #M20 J8-9 will be closed later this morning so freight can be held at J9. Pls check back for latest updates.
08:19 - 22 Jul 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite Kent Police say the decision to implement it was made due to traffic building up towards the port and Eurotunnel. Coastbound traffic will be diverted at junction 8 and rejoin the M20 at junction 9.
P&O Ferries Updates @POferriesupdate Follow [Dover] #OpStack on M20 J8-9 to be in place later this morning. We advise all non-freight traffic to use M2/A2 where possible to avoid delay
08:38 - 22 Jul 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite Kent Police is reminding lorry drivers that those at the front of the queue will get a ticket to continue their journey to the continent. Those who use the diversions for non-freight traffic in an attempt to get closer to the front, and who do not have a ticket, will be sent to the back of the Op Stack queue.
Last updated Wed 22 Jul 2015 Read more 3 updates The return of Operation Stack Travel operation stack Kent Dover m20
